greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table where the entry (n,k) (n >= 0, k >= 0) gives number of Motzkin paths of the length n with the minimum peak width of k.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9869 (rows n=0..139 of triangle, flattened)
example: E.g., we have the following nine Motzkin paths of length 4, of which the last 4 have each peak at least of width 1 and the last 2 with each peak at least 2 dashes wide, so M(4,0) = 9, M(4,1) = 4 and M(4,2) = 2.
mathematica: Mpw[n_, m_] := 1 + Sum[Sum[If[k == 0, 0, Binomial[i - 1, k - 1] Binomial[i, k - 1]/k] CC[n - m*k, 2i], {k, 1, i}], {i, 0, n/2}];
Table[a[n], {n, 0, 104}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 06 2016, adapted from Maple *)
xref: Column k=0: Motzkin numbers (A001006), column k=1: A004148, column k=2: A004149, column k=3: A023421, column k=4: A023422, column k=5: A023423. Uses the table A001263(n, k).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 03 2001
